003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.

007 * All rights reserved. Visit https://imagingbook.com for additional details.
008 *******************************************************************************/
009package Ch08_BinaryRegions;
010
011
012import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
013
014import java.util.List;
015
016import ij.IJ;
017import ij.ImagePlus;
018import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
019import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
020import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
021import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
022import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
023import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
024import imagingbook.common.color.iterate.RandomHueGenerator;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
026import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
027import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
028import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegionSegmentation;
029import imagingbook.common.regions.BreadthFirstSegmentation;
030import imagingbook.common.regions.DepthFirstSegmentation;
031import imagingbook.common.regions.RecursiveSegmentation;
032import imagingbook.common.regions.RegionContourSegmentation;
033import imagingbook.common.regions.SequentialSegmentation;
034import imagingbook.core.plugin.IjPluginName;
035import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
036
037/**
038 * <p>
039 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the use of various region labeling techniques
040 * provided by the imagingbook "regions" package:
041 * </p>
042 * <ul>
043 * <li>{@link BreadthFirstSegmentation},</li>
044 * <li>{@link DepthFirstSegmentation},</li>
045 * <li>{@link RecursiveSegmentation},</li>
046 * <li>{@link RegionContourSegmentation},</li>
047 * <li>{@link SequentialSegmentation}.</li>
048 * </ul>
049 * <p>
050 * See Sec. 8.1 of [1] for additional details. One of four labeling types can be
051 * selected (see the {@link #run(ImageProcessor)} method). All methods should
052 * produce the same results (except {@link RegionContourSegmentation}, which may
053 * run out of memory easily). Requires a binary image. Zero-value pixels are
054 * considered background, all other pixels are foreground. Display lookup tables
055 * (LUTs) are not considered. The plugin creates a new image with connected
056 * components either randomly-colored or region labels shown as gray values. The
057 * original image is not modified.
058 * If no image is currently open, the plugin optionally loads a suitable
059 * sample image.
060 * </p>
061 * <p>
062 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
063 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
064 * </p>
065 * 
066 * @author WB
067 * @version 2020/12/20
068 * @version 2022/09/28 revised
069 */
070@IjPluginName("Region Segmentation Demo")
071public class Region_Segmentation_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
072        
073        /** Enum type for various region labeling methods. */
074        protected enum SegmentationMethod {
075                Recursive,
076                DepthFirst, 
077                BreadthFirst,
078                Sequential,
079                RegionAndContours,
080        }
081
082        /** The region labeling method to be used. */
083        public static SegmentationMethod Method = SegmentationMethod.BreadthFirst;
084        /** Neighborhood type used for region segmentation (4- or 8-neighborhood). */
085        public static NeighborhoodType2D Neighborhood = NeighborhoodType2D.N8;
086        
087        /** Set true to randomly color segmented regions. */
088        public static boolean ColorRegions = true;
089        /** Set true to to list segmented regions to the console. */
090        public static boolean ListRegions = false;
091        
092        private ImagePlus im;
093        
094        /**
095         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image
096         * is currently open.
097         */
098        public Region_Segmentation_Demo() {
099                if (noCurrentImage()) {
100                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.ToolsSmall);
101                }
102        }
103        
104    @Override
105        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
106        this.im = im;
107                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES;
108    }
109        
110    @Override
111        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
112        
113        if (!runDialog())
114                return;
115        
116        if (Method == SegmentationMethod.Recursive && 
117                        !IJ.showMessageWithCancel("Recursive labeling", 
118                                        "This may run out of stack memory!\n" + "Continue?")) {
119                        return;
120        }
121
122        // Copy the original to a new byte image:
123        ByteProcessor bp = ip.convertToByteProcessor(false);
124        
125                BinaryRegionSegmentation segmentation = null;
126                switch(Method) {
127                case BreadthFirst :     
128                        segmentation = new BreadthFirstSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
129                case DepthFirst :               
130                        segmentation = new DepthFirstSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
131                case Sequential :               
132                        segmentation = new SequentialSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
133                case RegionAndContours : 
134                        segmentation = new RegionContourSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
135                case Recursive : 
136                        segmentation = new RecursiveSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
137                }
138                
139                if (!segmentation.isSegmented()) {
140                        IJ.showMessage("Something went wrong, segmentation failed!");
141                        return;
142                }
143
144                // Retrieve a list of detected regions (sorted by size):
145                List<BinaryRegion> regions = segmentation.getRegions(true);
146                
147                if (regions.isEmpty()) {
148                        IJ.showMessage("No regions detected!");
149                        return;
150                }
151                
152                // Show the resulting labeling as a color or gray image:
153                String title = im.getShortTitle() + "-" + Method.name();
154                ImageProcessor labelIp = ColorRegions ? //Display.makeLabelImage(segmenter, ColorRegions);
155                                makeLabelImageColor(segmentation) : makeLabelImageGray(segmentation);
156                (new ImagePlus(title, labelIp)).show();
157                
158                if (ListRegions) {
159                        IJ.log("Regions sorted by size: " + regions.size());
160                        for (BinaryRegion r: regions) {
161                                IJ.log(r.toString());
162                        }
163                }
164                
165    }
166
167    private boolean runDialog() {
168                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(Region_Segmentation_Demo.class.getSimpleName());
169                gd.addEnumChoice("Segmentation method", Method);
170                gd.addEnumChoice("Neighborhood type", Neighborhood);
171                gd.addCheckbox("Color result", ColorRegions);
172                gd.addCheckbox("List regions", ListRegions);
173                
174                gd.showDialog();
175                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
176                        return false;
177                }
178                
179                Method = gd.getNextEnumChoice(SegmentationMethod.class);
180                Neighborhood = gd.getNextEnumChoice(NeighborhoodType2D.class);
181                ColorRegions = gd.getNextBoolean();
182                ListRegions = gd.getNextBoolean();
183                return true;
184        }
185    
186    // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
187    
188    /**
189     * Returns a color image of the specified segmentation with randomly
190     * colored components.
191     * 
192     * @param segmenter a binary region segmentation
193     * @return a {@link ColorProcessor} with randomly colored regions 
194     */
195        public static ColorProcessor makeLabelImageColor(BinaryRegionSegmentation segmenter) {
196                int minLabel = segmenter.getMinLabel();
197                int maxLabel = segmenter.getMaxLabel();
198                
199                // set up a table of random colors, one for each label:
200                RandomHueGenerator rcg = new RandomHueGenerator();
201                int[] labelColor = new int[maxLabel + 1];
202                for (int i = minLabel; i <= maxLabel; i++) {
203                        labelColor[i] = rcg.next().getRGB();
204                }
205                
206                final int width = segmenter.getWidth();
207                final int height = segmenter.getHeight();
208                
209                ColorProcessor cp = new ColorProcessor(width, height);
210                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
211                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
212                                int lb = segmenter.getLabel(u, v);
213                                if (lb >= 0 && lb < labelColor.length) {
214                                        cp.set(u, v, labelColor[lb]);
215                                }
216                        }
217                }
218                return cp;
219        }
220        
221        /**
222     * Returns a 16-bit unsigned gray image of the specified segmentation with component
223     * pixels set to the associated segmentation labels.
224     * 
225     * @param segmenter a binary region segmentation
226     * @return a 16-bit {@link ShortProcessor} with the original region labels 
227     */
228        public static ShortProcessor makeLabelImageGray(BinaryRegionSegmentation segmenter) {
229                int width = segmenter.getWidth();
230                int height = segmenter.getHeight();
231                ShortProcessor sp = new ShortProcessor(width, height);
232                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
233                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
234                                int lb = segmenter.getLabel(u, v);
235                                sp.set(u, v, (lb >= 0) ? lb : 0);
236                        }
237                }
238                sp.resetMinAndMax();
239                return sp;
240        }
241    
242}
243
244
245
